bug.author: jpatts
bug.summary: Wrong "name" parameter default for Nadam optimizer
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/Nadam>https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/keras/optimizers/Nadam</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
Optional name attribute is said to default as "Adamax" rather than "Nadam" <denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
name: Optional name for the operations created when applying gradients. Defaults to "Adamax". <denchmark-h:h3>Correct links</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/v2.1.0/tensorflow/python/keras/optimizer_v2/nadam.py#L33-L238>https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/v2.1.0/tensorflow/python/keras/optimizer_v2/nadam.py#L33-L238</denchmark-link>
Source code correctly shows default as name="Nadam". Therefore documentation issue. <denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
Not at the moment

comments.comment: Please close this issue. The error was resolved in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/37111>#37111</denchmark-link>
